verses.verse: A good name <S%H8034><s%> is rather to be chosen <S%H977><s%> than great <S%H7227><s%> riches <S%H6239><s%>, and loving <S%H2896><s%> favour <S%H2580><s%> rather than silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold <S%H2091><s%>. loving: or, favour is better than, etc
The rich <S%H6223><s%> and poor <S%H7326><s%> meet together <S%H6298><s%>: the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is the maker <S%H6213><s%> of them all.

A prudent <S%H6175><s%> man foreseeth <S%H7200><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%>, and hideth <S%H5641><s%> <S%H5641><s%> himself: but the simple <S%H6612><s%> pass on <S%H5674><s%>, and are punished <S%H6064><s%>.

By <S%H6118><s%> humility <S%H6038><s%> and the fear <S%H3374><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> are riches <S%H6239><s%>, and honour <S%H3519><s%>, and life <S%H2416><s%>. By: or, The reward of humility, etc
Thorns <S%H6791><s%> and snares <S%H6341><s%> are in the way <S%H1870><s%> of the froward <S%H6141><s%>: he that doth keep <S%H8104><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> shall be far <S%H7368><s%> from them.

Train up <S%H2596><s%> a child <S%H5288><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%> he should go <S%H6310><s%>: and when he is old <S%H2204><s%>, he will not depart <S%H5493><s%> from it. Train: or, Catechise in: Heb. in his way

The rich <S%H6223><s%> ruleth <S%H4910><s%> over the poor <S%H7326><s%>, and the borrower <S%H3867><s%> is servant <S%H5650><s%> to the lender <S%H376><s%> <S%H3867><s%>. the lender: Heb. the man that lendeth

He that soweth <S%H2232><s%> iniquity <S%H5766><s%> shall reap <S%H7114><s%> vanity <S%H205><s%>: and the rod <S%H7626><s%> of his anger <S%H5678><s%> shall fail <S%H3615><s%>. the rod: or, with the rod of his anger he shall be consumed
He that hath a bountiful <S%H2896><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%> shall be blessed <S%H1288><s%>; for he giveth <S%H5414><s%> of his bread <S%H3899><s%> to the poor <S%H1800><s%>. He that: Heb. Good of eye
Cast out <S%H1644><s%> the scorner <S%H3887><s%>, and contention <S%H4066><s%> shall go out <S%H3318><s%>; yea, strife <S%H1779><s%> and reproach <S%H7036><s%> shall cease <S%H7673><s%>.

He that loveth <S%H157><s%> pureness <S%H2890><s%> <S%H2889><s%> of heart <S%H3820><s%>, for the grace <S%H2580><s%> of his lips <S%H8193><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> shall be his friend <S%H7453><s%>. for: or, and hath grace in his lips

The eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> preserve <S%H5341><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, and he overthroweth <S%H5557><s%> the words <S%H1697><s%> of the transgressor <S%H898><s%>. the words: or, the matters
The slothful <S%H6102><s%> man saith <S%H559><s%>, There is a lion <S%H738><s%> without <S%H2351><s%>, I shall be slain <S%H7523><s%> in <S%H8432><s%> the streets <S%H7339><s%>.
The mouth <S%H6310><s%> of strange women <S%H2114><s%> is a deep <S%H6013><s%> pit <S%H7745><s%>: he that is abhorred <S%H2194><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> therein.
Foolishness <S%H200><s%> is bound <S%H7194><s%> in the heart <S%H3820><s%> of a child <S%H5288><s%>; but the rod <S%H7626><s%> of correction <S%H4148><s%> shall drive it far <S%H7368><s%> from him.
He that oppresseth <S%H6231><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%> to increase <S%H7235><s%> his riches, and he that giveth <S%H5414><s%> to the rich <S%H6223><s%>, shall surely come to want <S%H4270><s%>.

Bow down <S%H5186><s%> thine ear <S%H241><s%>, and hear <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H1697><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%>, and apply <S%H7896><s%> thine heart <S%H3820><s%> unto my knowledge <S%H1847><s%>.

For it is a pleasant thing <S%H5273><s%> if thou keep <S%H8104><s%> them within <S%H990><s%> thee; they shall withal <S%H3162><s%> be fitted <S%H3559><s%> in thy lips <S%H8193><s%>. within: Heb. in thy belly
That thy trust <S%H4009><s%> may be in the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, I have made known <S%H3045><s%> to thee this day <S%H3117><s%>, even to thee. even: or, trust thou also
Have not I written <S%H3789><s%> to thee <S%H8032><s%> excellent things <S%H7991><s%> in counsels <S%H4156><s%> and knowledge <S%H1847><s%>,

That I might make thee know <S%H3045><s%> the certainty <S%H7189><s%> of the words <S%H561><s%> of truth <S%H571><s%>; that thou mightest answer <S%H7725><s%> the words <S%H561><s%> of truth <S%H571><s%> to them that send <S%H7971><s%> unto thee? to them: or, to those that send thee?
Rob <S%H1497><s%> not the poor <S%H1800><s%>, because he is poor <S%H1800><s%>: neither oppress <S%H1792><s%> the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> in the gate <S%H8179><s%>:
For the LORD <S%H3068><s%> will plead <S%H7378><s%> their cause <S%H7379><s%>, and spoil <S%H6906><s%> the soul <S%H5315><s%> of those that spoiled <S%H6906><s%> them.
Make no friendship <S%H7462><s%> with an angry <S%H639><s%> man <S%H1167><s%>; and with a furious <S%H2534><s%> man <S%H376><s%> thou shalt not go <S%H935><s%>:
Lest thou learn <S%H502><s%> his ways <S%H734><s%>, and get <S%H3947><s%> a snare <S%H4170><s%> to thy soul <S%H5315><s%>.
Be not thou one of them that strike <S%H8628><s%> hands <S%H3709><s%>, or of them that are sureties <S%H6148><s%> for debts <S%H4859><s%>.
If thou hast nothing to pay <S%H7999><s%>, why should he take away <S%H3947><s%> thy bed <S%H4904><s%> from under thee?
Remove <S%H5253><s%> not the ancient <S%H5769><s%> landmark <S%H1366><s%>, which thy fathers <S%H1><s%> have set <S%H6213><s%>. landmark: or, bound

Seest <S%H2372><s%> thou a man <S%H376><s%> diligent <S%H4106><s%> in his business <S%H4399><s%>? he shall stand <S%H3320><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> kings <S%H4428><s%>; he shall not stand <S%H3320><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> mean <S%H2823><s%> men. mean: Heb. obscure men
